website_summaries.verdict: Durable construction with handy features and numerous resistance levels that allow you to customize your workout.
pros: Offers impressive features for a low-end price that includes 6 resistance settings, noise reduction wheel, and easy-to-assemble design
cons: Rare reports of it wobbling with heavier users

customer_reviews.title: Super LOUD.. updated!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a huge pain. It's is VERY loud and shakes the walls in the room I have it set up in. I'm sure there are better options out there and maybe mine might be defective, but it's too loud to use as intended. Too bad the time to return has passed, because I've tried to make it work for months and unfortunately it is a huge disappointment. **Update** The company saw the above review and sent me a replacement. The replacement is much quieter and is in proper working order. Great customer support. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy t

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd have purchased this in September. I looked at many on Amazon and read many reviews. Chose this and it's exactly what I wanted. Set up in 5 minutes. Directions are followable, but funny to read. Easy to swap the skewer if you have a quick release, but directions say it'll work on a bolt axle. I see no reason why it wouldn't. Very very sturdy. Includes the front wheel cup so no need to purchase that separately. I'm not a competitive rider. 58 and ride 10-12 miles/day, 4 or 5 days a week ... spring and summer. Just trying to stay in shape, and this will keep me moving fall and winter. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rahm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good buy! It fits a downhill bike just fine, I did swap out the dh specific tire for a road tire to reduce the noise and not chew up the tread on a maxxis minion tire. Using it for pre and post ACL surgery and the setup is excellent, quality build and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Vajda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works nice, Magnet is something weak but works for my wife....
customer_reviews.text: Nice trainer, good price target, easy to setup, easy to use, we have paired with Wahoo Cadence, Wahoo Speed and Wahoo Tickr Heart Sensor, to be used with #Suffesfest App in IOS, my wife is a Novice or a starter, but we both love the trainer. Can not go wrong with this, used along with an app or alone, will do the work, Lets see it in a year of after of 4 - 5 hours weekly use!!
customer_reviews.author: Javi SF

customer_reviews.title: It's solid and it was easy to mount my bike in it
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the quality of this bike trainer stand, especially for the price. It's solid and it was easy to mount my bike in it. It comes fully assembled, so don't waste your money on the add-on for assembly. It'll take you maybe 2-3 minutes to get your bike mounted. It makes some riding noise with street tires, but it's not terrible. The range of resistance is good, but not that dramatic. A couple things: - yes, it works with bikes that have disc brakes (or it works with mine, anyway) - yes (according to the instructions) it works even if you don't have a quick release rear wheel
customer_reviews.author: zups

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy setup. Takes all of 1 minute to mount/dismount ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick easy setup. Takes all of 1 minute to mount/dismount a bike. Resistance mechanism works well. Regarding noise, it's going to be 100% a product of your tires. I put my large mountain bike with large 27.5+ tires with large knobby tread. This results in a loud workout, sounds like a chopper coming in for a landing. If I use my road bike with slick tires (so pretty much no tread), it's whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JamieJ

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my hybrid/city bike and it fits great. My resting bpm is a bit out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my hybrid/city bike and it fits great. My resting bpm is a bit out of control right now and I thought having a stationary bike would be an easy way to get some cardio in on weekdays (and it's still pretty cold/snowy here in Wisconsin). I live in an apartment complex and it's not very loud but it will make some noise. Setting it up was really easy. The whole thing is pretty much ready to go, you would just need to replace the skewer and get everything into position. It's pretty easy to take on and off and put it away too.
customer_reviews.author: Brit B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to set up. The adjustable resistance setting is nice. My only beef is that the instructions say the max resistance setting is 1 and the min resistance setting is 6. I found the opposite to be true. 6 max - 1 min. I hope this is just a writing error. Lost in translation?
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT A

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: This trainer is good if you ride slow (maybe under 15 mph). If you ride any faster you will see massive tire wear. I average 19-20mph on a trainer, and after biking 10 miles, I could see rubber specs all over the ground around the trainer. It was actually melting the rubber. After feeling the rubber it was likely in the range of 140-150 deg F, and was uncomfortable to the touch. If you ride relatively fast, I would recommend spending a bit more on a better mag trainer or a fluid trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to setup. Instructions are a little vague when it comes to the amount of pressure to put in the back wheel, but was able to look up a couple of videos that gave a good idea. Not sure if mine is off, but it’s definitely not quiet. I bought to ride in the morning but will not be able to as I live on the 2nd floor and the neighbors below me can definitely hear it. It’s not much louder than a vacuum, but too loud for 6 am. Resistance works great and can switch on the fly to give me a varied workout. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this stand and after taking it out of the package I find that the resistance wheel mount is made of plastic and broken. One would think that if you were going to build something that is intended for constant use with pressure you would make it out of metal!! This is a piece of junk and I would not recommend ordering it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: chad schnell

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again without hesitation!
customer_reviews.text: Good functional design, solid well made and rock solid when riding. Very easy fast setup. If you’re having trouble with puzzles for 5-7 year olds it may take you a while, otherwise you’ll be up and riding in 5 minuets. Yes it’s noisy especially with nobby’s, street tires are not a problem. Quick easy removal or re-mount when taking bike off and on for real ride. I’d buy again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Getintheshade

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about getting this bike trainer and so disappointed. It will not support my 26 inch road bike. The bolt that holds the axle in place is not long enough and had to adjust all the way out. Also, The Nut to tighten the bolt is made of plastic. It will not work for 6" axle as described. Bike leans and bolt bends down when you try to sit on it. It is well made otherwise and really sorry I could not make it work. There is no support number, just an email for missing parts. IF they had made the bolt longer I think it may have worked fine. Too bad no contact for support.
customer_reviews.author: King Family

customer_reviews.title: no resistance. loud.
customer_reviews.text: I backed out the only adjustment knob all the way and there's still hardly any resistance. It just didn't have enough mounting adjustments to work with my 27.5" giant with 2.4" tires. The axle is pretty long and I couldn't get it centered. I gave up pretty quickly and tried a 26" bike with 2.1" tires. It centered really easily but as I said earlier, there's just no resistance. Since there's no resistance it just spins up to full speed where it's too loud to use indoors. I could take it to the garage but there's no resistance so what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to use and quiet! :)
customer_reviews.text: This stand was up and running in 5 minutes. It holds my bike firmly and is very quiet. I have a road bike with very smooth tires and there is very little noise with this stand. I am also impressed with how easy it is to remove the bike when I have the chance to take it outside. It was a great price too! Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: bikergirl

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trainer, Great workout system to prevent stagnation during the cold winter weather. Resistance adjustments are great to have. I'm using a road bike and there is very minimal noise during my workouts. Off road tires will create loud noise on any of these types of trainers due to inconsistent surface contact on the system. Easy to set up and compact when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for six months only
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this trainer just over six months and difficulty settings changer has become so hard to move and the whole thing isn’t working properly anymore 😔it was good for a short time but I wish I could contact the company to exchange it because it had been what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Vinson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to send it back. The skewer does not fit so I could not attach the bike at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for home gyms
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of this purchase because i didn't know how easy it would be to set up my bike as an exercise bike, then dismount it and take it for a ride, but i decided to give this a try and am extremely happy. I'm still figuring out the settings (how the 1-6 correlate with the 21 speeds on my bike), but i got in a few good exercises, and this gives me the added option of watching TV or listening to a book on speaker while riding. Great for home gyms.
customer_reviews.author: cnglover

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This trainer bent the skewer it came with and got stuck in my wheel. This happened a second time to a different axel. I have used trainers with this bike in the past without issue. This will have to go back.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and fold away
customer_reviews.text: If you want a quick solution to riding and getting a quick 15miles in the morning while watching the news indoors without spending hundreds on a stationary bike...this is a quick solution. No fancy bells and whistles. Easy setup and fold away. Place it on a sturdy hard surface, not carpet! you will learn real fast. Great for riding indoors when it's COLD, ICY or WINDY!
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken!
customer_reviews.text: Bike trainer arrived broken. To be exact the part that was broken was the bolt that props up the “resistor wheel”. I don’t believe it was damaged during the delivery process because the box has no damage on it But possibly poor quality and or cheap plastic used. I would expect this kind of product out of the cheaper bicycle trainers but for this one being around $100 I am extremely disappointed. Will return for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Check your bike first!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this stand I did not realize it won’t work with just any bike. I was unable to make it work with any of my bikes I had. After making the investment and then giving up on it I decided to look into a little more expensive style of bicycle and found out that the issue was the bike. Which the cheapest I found with this style of quick change rear axle was $300!! After buying the new bike I now like this product but would never have made the initial investment if I had known the details.
customer_reviews.author: Waylon

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT WORK WITH THRU-AXELS
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this product - however, it does not work with my rear thru-axel (I have a specialized ruby elite). I tried to get the quick release provided to work on my bike but it wouldn’t - finally googled it and saw that it wasn’t working because it was a different type of axle. I’m so annoyed and disappointed. I’m considering buying an adapter but I’m worried it won’t work with this trainer.
customer_reviews.author: LJR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, easy to set up and ride my bike with. You can switch between the different resistances that it has to offer with ease. I lost alot of weight with it and realized that I'm no longer fat and depressed but in-shape and depressed. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Broke but still buying

customer_reviews.title: Buy bike trainer tire with this item
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Was super easy to setup and very sturdy. Something to make note: don't use normal tires, even if they are road tires. Like Indy car tires they will get hot and you won't be able to use them on the road. If you clamp down too tight on the tire it will start to gum up on ya. Purchase a "bike trail specific tire" as well just for this trainer because they are made with harder rubber. Noise it very minimal especially if you're rockin out to some tunes.
customer_reviews.author: Bloodline

customer_reviews.title: Tire tread matters
customer_reviews.text: Update #1. [Changed to 4 of 5 stars]: This seller/manufacturer reached out to me about my (below) feedback and offered a full refund or a new unit. I agreed to a new unit. I can say now that the noise level is highly attributable to the TIRE you use and not this trainer. Knobby MB tires will be loud/louder than road tires. Otherwise a very sturdy and capable trainer. Thanks Sportneer! Initial review: [3 of 5 stars] I couldn't believe the other reviews about how LOUD this thing is. My family can hear me from my upstairs detached garage all the way into my house. Also wearing out my rear tire lugs. But it's better than being sedentary!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Good basic trainer. Misleading instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Update: The trainer is pretty good. At this price point it is good quality and it handles my bike very well. It has worked admirably for the last few weeks on several workouts. Warning almost ALL bikes have a bolt axle. Note in the picture needs to be BEFORE the instruction to replace with quick release. Now I have to repack wheel and rebuild. It's sort of my fault but annoying and I may have avoided if I had not been so linear and read instructions in order. I might update review after I fix wheel.
customer_reviews.author: targetsb

customer_reviews.title: Feels just like riding on the street
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could get in shape while it's cold outside. Prepping for the cycle season that's coming soon. Happy with the product, We'll made.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Too loud for me.  Planning of replacing with Fluid Trainer.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bike trainer for the price but in my opinion this is still too loud for me. I am thinking of replacing this with the bike fluid hoping that will make a difference. I only used it 3x since I bought it. I took a video of it so you decide if you still want to buy it or not.
customer_reviews.author: ARed1925

customer_reviews.title: Good but mount dropped my bike randomly
customer_reviews.text: So I finally set this up and tried it. Everything seemed to go well and it was very easy to setup. My one thing is that at one point my bike fell out of the mount. Luckily I clipped out through instinct because I would have knocked my head on the coffee table otherwise! 😬😵 So I don’t know how or why it happened. There doesn’t seem to be a way to tighten anything. Maybe it was mounted wrong. Will update if this problem persists (I hope not) or never happens again. Also it is sort of loud, I can’t imagine a neighbor could hear it but not silent by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Heather MacInnes

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't fit ALL bikes. The screw needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit ALL bikes. The screw needs to be longer which would provide a more stable platform. I think I am two turns into and I really need more. I looked into a longer screw with no success. It's also louder than I anticipated. I'm using it, but not WOWED by the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Wright

customer_reviews.title: So loud!!! Stable but way too noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March so we could exercise during Covid. Unfortunately, The description said that it was “noiseless” - Wow, not true! It is stable - but super loud. I tried adjusting every which way - but makes a screeching, super loud whirring noise. It’s not fun to use because even with headphones on - it’s so loud and it bothers everyone else in the house too. I will say it’s nice and stable - but unusable due to noise.
customer_reviews.author: absent-minded prof.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but.........
customer_reviews.text: I started using this the other day with my beach cruiser. I works fine but with my knobby tires it is a loud ride. Unless you have street tire this will be loud. You can adjust the roller in the back to not make contact with your back tire but then your just peddling with no resistance so your going to have to pick whats more important to you, the exercise or the noise........On that note I just turned up my TV and rode it. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Curly

customer_reviews.title: Brillant!
customer_reviews.text: I used a treadmill for years. Sold the treadmill and switch to this bike trainer. The treadmill was noisy when running it bounced on the neigbors concrete floor. I was hesitant about the noise for the bike trainer but it is for outside. I have a large terrace outside the condo I doubt I will bother anyone this winter. I would use it inside. Its not bothering me at all. It took me 2 minutes to set up the bike. I did not even open the instruction. I think its worth the $90.
customer_reviews.author: N. Berube

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE my new trainor!! I put together in about 10 minutes. It is super sturdy. I just got it today and immediately rode an hour while watching Netflix. This is exactly what I had been looking for. Living in Las Vegas with summertime heat over a 100 degrees rules out biking outside. I needed something I could train on to keep in shape and lose weight. I bought a trainor before this with rollers that was aweful and difficult to use. My regret is that I didn't buy this originally!! 💪
customer_reviews.author: Cuinn

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my bike
customer_reviews.text: sadly this product did not work for my bike and I had to return it. I don't have any fancy bike. Walmart $100 Mens 700c ridgeland did not work for this product. I needed to get a different tire for it. If i bought a diff tire just for this device I'd be dropping another $100. Was very sad when I figured out my bike was no good with this machine, looked forward to using it in the winter months at home.
customer_reviews.author: Karolina Stypulkowski

customer_reviews.title: Loud and clunky. Hate it.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews on this trainer are very good so I bought it without hesitation. It’s arrived and assembled and I HATE it. It’s clunky, loud and a super rough ride. Did I do something wrong? Can’t help wonder how anyone could like this thing let alone love it or give it more than one star.
customer_reviews.author: LISA N.

customer_reviews.title: noise
customer_reviews.text: I live in a townhouse so unfortunately the noise is a huge issue. It sounds like I am riding a motorcycle in the house. I cant even hear myself think. I don't know if I should invest in buying a road bike to use just inside or if there's something I can do about the mountain bike tires that I have. I was really excited to ride in the house but I cant ride for more than one minute because the noise is just awfully loud.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice, well built bike trainer.
customer_reviews.text: My order came before scheduled arrival, and it is a well built, sturdy bike trainer. The resistance settings, along with your own gear settings can make for a worthwhile workout. I'm old school and ride a 28" Schwinn Continental with 27" wheels...in perfect condition, I might add, purchased in 1981 and while there is no quick release on the rear wheel...it works perfectly with this trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but plastic housing was broken
customer_reviews.text: I made the decision not to return this product as it seems like it will work but unfortunately the plastic housing around the flywheel, where your rear wheel rests against to provide some resistance, was broken on delivery. My thought is it should work for a while but it is broken bad enough that someday it may give. Wasn't worth the hassle of returning it. Short of that it is a pretty good product and holds the bike fairly stable.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoBluesGuitarist

customer_reviews.title: Problem resolved quickly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased bike trainer back in June of 2018. Performed well as expected for 7 months (although I did have to re-tighten shaft securing pressure plate nut which became loose after several weeks of use). After 7 months the smoothness of resistance setting became erratic. After taking apart and examining, I found the aluminum pressure plate disc shaft hole had gone out of round and became oblong through wear. Contacted the company, sent them a picture and they immediately sent a whole new bike trainer replacement. No questions asked. Great company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Wingerd

customer_reviews.title: Very loud wheel - Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Totally disappointed with how loud the wheel is. It vibrates my walls, the surrounding furniture AND me which makes me feel nauseous. I cannot recommend! I bought this specifically bc I wanted to be mindful of the sound for my neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Morales

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your floor is leveled!
customer_reviews.text: Going on week 3, and I love it! After a week, I had an ache in my upper right hip area. I realized that it wasn’t the trainer. The section of the house I was training on had an unleveled floor. I noticed my bike was slightly (I mean slightly!) leaning. This hurt my body alignment and caused the ache. Once I found a leveled part of my home, I stopped experiencing the aches. Note: Check your floor leveling! Yes, sometimes your floors are not leveled perfectly. This may not effect your living, but it will effect you if you have something on it that you NEED to be leveled on.
customer_reviews.author: Bertha Alicia Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work well and quietly. Some people in reviews have had good luck and some did not. It was easy to assemble..but if you've ever stuck a baseball card in bicycle spokes as a kid then you know the sound. It was like I was riding a dirt bike in my living room. I have a few bikes and couldn't get one to work quietly on this. I boxed it back up within an hour of opening it and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet enough for me to listen to music with headphones at a low-med volume. Very sturdy even though I'm using it on a rug with thick padding underneath. I left the resistance dial on 3 and prefer to use the gears on the bike to adjust resistance. I was hesitant to purchase an indoor trainer, because they can be quite expensive. I don't need a smart trainer or a power meter, and I don't plan on subscribing to Zwift. The Sportneer is inexpensive, but does everything I need it to. I love being able to bike when it's cold out now. Would highly recommend getting the Sportneer trainer.
customer_reviews.author: ren76

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product & Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sturdy bike trainer. My hubby had it up and ready for me in about 15 minutes. He said the assembly was easy and simple. I don't find the noise level to be loud or problematic. It's fairly quiet and I'd describe the noise to be something like a little whirr sound, which is just from the back tire rotating. I started using it today and discovered that it doesn't work well when I want to stand and pedal. I guess I thought it would function like a spin bike but maybe all trainers at this level are like that. Overall, it seems to be well made and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Still not sure about the sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'1 175lbs and used this transform my bike into a cycle bike for my wife and I. The concept and overall product are very smart. The quality and price don't seem to quite match, I would be happier if it were $20 less or so. The back tire latch still doesn't seem very sturdy and looks to bend. I had to return the first one because the screw was stripped on this same latch. I am worried there is a design flaw in there somewhere, but for now, it is holding up. The tension adjusts pretty decently. The other reason I am only giving it three stars is it is quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Quality equipment, but NOISY!!
customer_reviews.text: No assembly required other than to put the bike on it and attach the tension control. This is a heavy duty piece of equipment, not wobbly at all, very adjustable to any desired tension. Very glad I ordered it. I would have given it an overall 5 star, but it is extremely noisy. I'm ready to try to take that piece apart and try to quiet it down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with terrific customer support
customer_reviews.text: Rode the trainer 3-4 days a week about an hour a day for 4 months. Roller wear due to tire friction was seemingly quick. The setup is easy and and the trainer is certainly stable. The resistance magnetic system does provide good increases to the workout . But due to the roller wear I emailed Sportneer for a replacement part and apparently they do not have parts in the warehouse and informed me to that purchasing a new one may be the best course of action. However the following day of the email, customer support went to lengths to ensure my happiness and they certainly did. I thank Sportneer for providing terrific customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: devil down under

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is VERY LOUD
customer_reviews.text: This trainer seems very well built and sturdy. Easy to attach your bike and get pedaling. I like being able to adjust resistance both using the meter that comes with the unit and my bike gears. There must be hundreds of potential resistance combinations. I'm glad that I decided to set this up in the basement though, because it is extremely loud. I recommend wearing headphones, which you'll need to anyway if you want to listen to music, podcasts, videos, whatever, while you exercise. Even if not listening to any media, I'd recommend headphones or earplugs just to deaden the noise.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great way to build confidence in learning to ride while exercising
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy product. It works great once you figure out how to assemble it. The video and instructions are lacking. My wife does not know how to ride a bike so this helps her brain learn how to get around the bike like gear switching, braking, and peddling. These are what I call brain muscle tasks like picking up a cup or walking, etc. Once we take away all of that and place it into the brain muscle, she can concentrate with balancing while riding. That should be a natural thing. As kids, its easy to learn and getup from falls, but not so much as aging people.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trainer for the money
customer_reviews.text: My wife is very happy with her Sportneer Bike Trainer Stand. It has allowed her to keep biking with the weather in the 90’s. It will allow her to get her exercise when we get into the bad winter weather. Her bike can be removed easily from the stand and reinstalled. Her bike is a Electra Towne Go bike. It is a Bosch electric assist bike. Obviously, she does not use electric assist on the trainer. However, the trainer is equipped with a device to adjust the resistance as you are using the Sportneer.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: When we originally got ours, I was very excited to put it together since I heard great reviews but it was very LOUD!! I then returned it and the company's customer service team was AMAZING!! They reached out to me and said they will send me a new stand, I received the stand right away and was able to put it together last night. The result was much better. Thank you so much Sportneer for going the extra mile to make a customer happy. This means alot to all of us!
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, zero assembly required other than adjusting the cups to your axle length. My bike has a thru axle rear with 700x35 tires and it it very secure. The addition of the front riser block, which not many include is an excellent touch and makes an already good deal better pricewise. Not overly loud, and I think many of the noise complaints might be attributed to tires - I run slicks and it is quiet, no louder than a box fan on low, for example. Four stars for initial impressions, I will update once I have used it for a while and tested its durability.
customer_reviews.author: egm7691

customer_reviews.title: Amended: 5 star review!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I received a defective product. However, after writing a review detailing the experience, Sportineer promptly got in touch with me and offered a free replacement. Great customer service! As for the bike stand, it's working out very well! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Broken, parts missing, and no one will replace
customer_reviews.text: I'm super disappointed. I bought this last fall as a gift. Held on to it until a month or so ago and gifted it. The rod to hold the bike on the trainer is missing, and the part that flips up on the back is broken off. I contacted the manufacturer (who SAYS they offer lifetime warranty), they basically just shrugged and said, "It's not our problem." Amazon? I can't even figure out who I'm supposed to contact...was told Amazon Services LLC...but can't find a way to contact them at all. So, basically, I just wasted a bunch of money to give a big ugly doorstop as a gift. Yippee.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: This is soooo loud. Sounds like a dirt bike in the house. Is it not working right?
customer_reviews.author: VeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Check your bike specs before ordering
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about now, but the online specifications could have been more clear upfront. This does not work with tire sizes above 26" unless you elevate the frame itself (ie on 2x4s). A quick release rear tire is required and you must remove your riding axle and replace with the one provided including the provided nuts. To make the bike roadworthy the axle must be switched back. Keep track of both sets of axles, the springs and nuts. Noise level is medium to high. Once assembled it works as described but is noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product to get real road-like feel in the comfort of your home!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 225 pounds and this bicycle stand is remarkably sturdy and well made. It arrived before they said it would and allows me to continue my workouts even during this time when the gyms are closed due to Covid-19. Setup was a snap and the added feature of six resistance settings allows me to get a real road like feel. It actually is quiet and what little noise there is is probably due to my tire tread pattern. Best of all, in addition to my 2-wheel bikes it also works on my recumbent, a 3-wheel Catrike. I would HIGHLY recommend this trainer, particularly at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C - Youngstown, OH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but loud.
customer_reviews.text: I love the trainer. It's very easy to set up and the tension works great. The negative... it's loud. Like seriously loud. In addition, I have a mountain bike and it wore down the center tread on the tire. Not a huge deal since all the other treads were still o.k.
customer_reviews.author: Love my Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how easy this was to put together. I’m very mechanically challenged, and I got this trainer up and spinning in less than 10 minutes. Other reviewers say it’s about as loud as a vacuum, but I’ve never heard a vacuum this quiet in my life. It’s also super sturdy. I’m a big girl with a big bike and feel perfectly comfortable on this trainer. I’m very pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lightbody

customer_reviews.title: Flooring makes a BIG difference in sound level
customer_reviews.text: I first tried using this trainer with my Fuji Gran Fondo with slick tires in my living room with a laminated wood floor over a crawl space. The noise was quite bad - an almost electric drone that increased in pitch with peddle speed. The next day I moved it out to my shop and placed it over the concrete floor on a couple of thick rubber mats - no drone! It’s now very quiet to ride. Seems like the wood flooring caused some type of harmonic vibration not present on a concrete floor. Very happy with the trainer and I’d recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works with Schwinn Cruiser Bike
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My husband put it together in less than 20 minutes. I was concerned that it wouldn’t work with a cruiser bike but I haven’t had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: JLH1985

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor leg exercise
customer_reviews.text: I had my knee replaces a few weeks ago and the range of motion and muscle control was taking a longer time to recoup. This unit allowed my to ride my outdoor bike inside. I am around 250lbs and the stand is very sturdy. Easy to setup and is fairly quite with the remote magnetic resistance fly wheel. This allows me to to keep my knee bending and strengthens my upper quads.
customer_reviews.author: CAH

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I stripped the threads of the tightening screw and they sent me a replacement free of charge and hassles. I have been using the device for 4 months now that I am not going to the gym because of the coronas. It suits my needs well. The trick is to not inflate the bike tires as much as normal. It caused me to have to tighten the screw against too much pressure, which stripped it. I usually use 65 psi for my tires when riding my bicycle but am now using about 40.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sweeny

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, reasonable price, fits the bike well!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my hubby. He is very pleased with it and it fits his bike perfectly. We set this up in the basement so he can get some use out of the bike more frequently. It is a little noisy, but oh well! He will probably use headphones while on it. I have read that some people buy an extra wheel so as not to wear out their back wheel, but we haven’t done that as of yet. I am happy with this purchase and felt that the price was reasonable because the stand is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. McNulty

customer_reviews.title: Only works with quick-release tires, not bolt axle tires
customer_reviews.text: I have to return this. Tried it with my bolt axle bike and it rubs the right side of the resistance wheel, making it unusable. Others have complained about this, which I discovered after purchasing. The lever clamp that stabilizes one side of the tire needs to be made longer, in order to allow bolt-axle bikes to be secured in the center of the resistance wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Sax

customer_reviews.title: I recommend. The tires you have will determine noise level.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend. The tires you have will determine noise level. This is very sturdy, I’m not worried about it collapsing or anything. It is rather loud, but that has to do with the tires on my bike. They are for mountain biking, so they are wider with thick tread. The trainer itself isn’t really noisy. The piece to set the front tire in is too skinny for my tires so it wound up bending the edges a tad with pressure. Luckily, that’s something I can deal with later if it breaks. Overall, I think this is a great trainer and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer29109

customer_reviews.title: Actually Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Finally found an indoor trainer quiet enough to use in an apartment. I have neighbors on both sides and below me and have heard no complaints. Putting max effort out in a standing sprint, the sound never gets above 80dB, roughly the volume of a standard vacuum cleaner. Most of the time it is closer to 70-75dB, or the volume of casual conversation. That said, some sort of padding is recommended to really dampen the sound. It offers good resistance and could not be easier to set up. Ignore suggested tire width limitations, I fit 700x42mm just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dina T.

customer_reviews.title: Really a great product
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised. I have an older bike and it was so easy to set up. The only thing I am not understanding as of yet is the amount of pressure to apply to the back tire when tightening it. It seems pretty tense when tightening all the way to the point that I don't have to increase the tension at all right now until I get in better shape of course. If anyone has a suggestion for me, it will be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Noise issues but support has been really helpful
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review to 4 stars as the product is very good, the one I got has an issue, and the support has been fantastic. There is something rattling on mine that is causing a secondary noise that is really loud. I emailed support about it, and they had me go through a couple of troubleshooting steps, none of which fixed the issue. They opted to send me a new one. Hopefully the new one won't have the additional sound to it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Armbrister

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trainer
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are always trying to find workouts that we enjoy. Cycling is probably our favorite, however during the winter months it is tough and have been having a hard time finding workouts that we both enjoy. I found the Sportneer trainer and have to say I was impressed. I just received it and tested it in both of my bicycles. Setup is very easy. It produces sound but not as high as I was expecting after reading some of the reviews. Some of which compared it to a vacuum cleaner and wonder if they received a defective item. Nonetheless, great trainer, foldable, easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: FG

customer_reviews.title: Deafening noise level
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of doing quick workouts at home during shelter-in-place. I assembled it within 15 minutes and started riding. I loved the resistance levels and the ability to change them easily to mimic a spin class. But unfortunately the sound was deafening. Even though I have a light women’s road bike with hybrid (fairly narrow) tires, the sound was untenable. I had to crank up my TV to the absolute loudest level. Not pleasant for anyone, especially my downstairs neighbor. Unfortunately this is going to have to go back. If not for the sound this would be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Before I got a smart trainer y went for this one, just to see if training indoors was something I would want to do instead of going to the gym for spinning classes. Brilliant product. Easy to setup. Starting using it right out of the box. Not even thinking about getting a smart trainer yet. I am using my triathlon bike with it. Don't care tioo miuch about the resistance control that you can attach to the handlebars. I just shift gears if I want more resistance. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Nunez

customer_reviews.title: This works well
customer_reviews.text: I got the trainer to keep cycling during the brutally cold months. It is easy to assemble and to load a bicycle. It also has the required sturdiness to keep the bicycle steady. No, a trainer is not nearly as fun as getting outside - but until the weather warms, it will do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price! By no means is this a high-end trainer, but it works great for a garage/basement gym. The wheel is a little noisy (high-pitched hum) but you definitely can get a good workout on here - I use it for bot HIIT and steady state training. My only complaint is it does now really work for bolt axels (my old single speed is too narrow to fit in the mechanism). So if you have a new bike with quick release or several gears you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Beck

customer_reviews.title: Simple, silent and stable
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike trainer from Amazon after I saw it in REI for $599. The Amazon price of $100 was much better and I decided to give it a try. As soon as I hooked it on my bike I stopped using my static bike. Especially in the winter months when the northwest weather is not the best for cycling this trainer is the perfect choice for me. I saw some comments where few people complained about wearing off the tire but if you inflate the tire to a high enough pressure this is minimal. Since the tire is designed for this I will say this is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this weekly! I’m an avid cyclist, but hitting the road isn’t alway an option for me. When Covid hit, I was looking for a way to incorporate more movement and this nifty device was my answer! It is a bit on the noisy side (my cat is alway very interested), but other than that it’s really great! Very easy to use and easy to set up. I now leave my bike on the stand and ride while watching TV. Luxury lol.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it!!! Easy to install, very sturdy and not very loud for a bike trainer. Highly recommend! Glad I didn’t buy a more expensive one. Only complaint is the tension clip does not fit my horizontal handle. I had to put it on the bottom and is relatively inconvenient as I no longer have 3 handle options while riding but not the end of the world. Overall would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sgraff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, made for road tires.
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to adjust the resistance and insert/remove the bike from the frame. It is pretty noisy if you choose to use knobby or mountain-bike tires, and they may not last long. This item is made for road-bikes with road (smooth) tires.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: With a true trainer tire, this product is silent when using. I have it set up in my basement and can easily watch and hear TV while cranking. And it's simple to swap out my bike and swap in my wife's. The stand is sturdier than expected. I only wish the resistance went higher. I can tell a slight difference going through each level from 1-6, but wish there was even more for a true hard climb.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pekoc

customer_reviews.title: Stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my husband to extend his bike riding through the winter and during the rainy season. It consumed a minimal amt of space, one can regulate the ride for ease or increase the intensity for a more strenuous workout! Great product for the intended purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Leitch

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this item for a few weeks now and I absolutely love it! It's study and well made. I live in an apartment and use a road tired (smoother than mountain tires), and it's so quiet! It's been everything I hoped it would be. My advice is to make sure you have the tools to take off the fly wheel for when your putting in the quick release. We had to have the local bike shop help us because we didn't have the tool.
customer_reviews.author: jdix

customer_reviews.title: Great resistence range, worth it even after covid price increase
customer_reviews.text: According to camel3x, this has been hovering around $90 until a month ago, when it jumped to $130. Honestly, it's still not a bad price even at the 40% markup. It's sturdy, and with the 6 resistance levels I can get any difficulty level I could want from easy to hard without even using my front derailleur. It is on the noisy side, but if that's what makes it affordable that's a fine trade-off in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far I think this is a great trainer, have used it 5 times now. Noise level isn't horrible but don't expect for it to be whisper quiet; I can still watch a show while riding and hear everything okay. We live on the 2nd floor of an apartment so I have placed a yoga mat and blanket under the trainer to help the vibration/noise. The different resistance levels are nice and can tell a difference between 1 & 6. For the price I think this is a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner rider
customer_reviews.text: It was a little daunting to put together by yourself. I needed more hands to hold my bike as I replaced the quick release back tire bolt (whatever it’s called). It’s quiet, I live in an apartment, I also have smooth road tires on my bike. Took me a few to figure out the resistant. Shipped super fast, I got a text on a Tues and said it would arrive the following Monday and I actually received it the day after I got the text message. Overall, I am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: lablover114

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Choice - solid, simple, and easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations, but I didn't have to. I followed the item that was rated "Amazon's choice". Good move. This thing comes pre-assembled and is super-solid. It is easy to deploy and works surprisingly well. I liked the price. It makes noise, but no more than the fancy exercise cycle machines; and I can attribute much of the noise to my tires on a hybrid-road/mountain bike. This gives me the ability to do fitness winter biking with MY BIKE. I'm impressed. Delivery was fast also. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: G. Knoop

customer_reviews.title: Good but unavoidably loud
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assemble and use, certainly good for indoor exercise, however cycling proves to be quite loud so i suggest earphones and hope that the neighbours don't mind the weird siren-like continuous sound while you're exercising. Haven't tried changing my tires for a smoother profile, perhaps that would decrease the sound more. Nevertheless i am very happy with my purchase and have been using it daily without complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Pirc

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: Updated. I like it except for the noise using original tire with treads. I bought a smooth tire no noise now. So it’s not the trainer it’s the tire that makes the noise. Happy :).
customer_reviews.author: Harris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, not too heavy, sturdy and good resistance! I live in an apt with neighbors below me and behind me. I have been spinning at 7am with no complaints yet due to the noise. It doesnt bother me, I actually thought that it would be louder. Overall its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Stationary Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is VERY sturdy, heavier than the bike I am using with it, yet light enough to pull out/put back whenever. I love it as I set it up in a few minutes and ride it whenever I have a chance. I don't have to go to gym. As it is lightweight and portable, I will be able to move into our garage when we go back to rain. When we have guests, simply pull the bike off, fold the trainer up and stash away. I highly recommend as this is such a better deal (if you already have a bike) than a stationary bike and much more space efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and fairly  sturdy. I'm not comfortable out of the saddle
customer_reviews.text: I decided I wanted to bring my bike in for a convenient indoor workout once a week to break the gym monotony. Although I'm a self-described girly girl, I was able to figure it out pretty quickly. No real strength required. It just needs the axle pulled out of yours and replaced with their pin. The piece on the back of the device pulls down and screws to the right length to raise the frame to meet your bike. Directions are pretty worthless so watch the video on Amazon. If I could do it so can you. 15 minutes tops.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Serves its minimum purpose
customer_reviews.text: Had this for like half a month by now. It works very well with my bicycle. I like the adjustable resistance. It’s a bit noisy to me, but not super bad. Not sure if it’s my bicycle or the product, but I’m still not comfortable with riding off of the seat (Position 3). The bicycle tends to wobble and not tolerate that position well. I had to sit down immediately. Other than that, I am excited and satisfied with using this at home.
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: No tools needed ready to use.
customer_reviews.text: It came ready to use out of the box. One key bit of the flywheel was loose in the box. I am glad I held on to it because without it the whole thing would not work. The instructions could have been better. Maybe a video link. I did not need to change out the quick release. It was way easier to set up just by getting the bike into position it all fell into place. Ready to go in under 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with the Sportneer Direct bike trainer. At first the product was very loud and vibrated hard making it awful to use, but their customer support was very helpful and sent me a new one that works great. The trainer works well, and while it may not be the fanciest trainer you can buy, for the price the value is very very good. I'd easily recommend this to anyone wanting to ride their bike indoors throughout a cold winter!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: If you live on the second floor. But something under the stand because of the verbation
customer_reviews.text: One thing I dislike about this stand is for some reason it makes very loud squeaky noise. I check the bike and the stand to make sure everything is connected. Everything was and is solid One good thing is, its very solid stand. Not very load (it does verbrate a little ). PS I wish it had more gears not just six; usually start on 4 and go up
customer_reviews.author: Ze' Costa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pandemic
customer_reviews.text: It's now August, 85 degrees outside, and all the gyms are closed in my state. I had thought that by now the pandemic would be long gone, but gave in to reality two weeks ago and purchased this because I love biking and I need the exercise. It's great. Easy to hook up and sturdy. It makes a moderate humming noise, which I actually find soothing. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Horace

customer_reviews.title: Great product and even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: I received the trainer that was defective. It was loud and sent vibrations throughout the apartment. I contacted the company with my issues. They offered suggests, they helped but the trainer still made a lot of noise as I increased my cadence. The company apologized for my issues and immediately sent me a new one. It was like day and night. The replacement is quieter and doesn't vibrate as I pedal faster. Very satisfied! Don't be a couch potato. You can watch a game or a movie while working out!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Vera

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap trainer!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set up. Seems sturdy so far. Super quiet with the right tire. If you put a slick tire on it is worth the effort. I initially had a tire with small knobs and the trainer was pretty noisy. I ordered a wtb thick slick 26 x 2.0 and now all I here is the drivetrain of the bike. I’m using an old 26” wheel mountain bike with the trainer and so far so good. I picked up a cheap heart rate monitor as well so I can keep track of time spent, heart rate and calories burned....
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: Sportneer Bike Trainer Stand Steel Bicycle Exercise Magnetic Stand with Noise Reduction Wheel for Road Bike
feature_bullets: STABILITY ON ANY SURFACE: Built with a wide base and low stance for unshakable balance. Features 5 adjustable antislip rubber feet to even out any uneven flooring

SPIN IN SILENCE: Smooth, seamless design and noise reduction resistance wheel mean you there’s no need to amp up the volume when you build up the burn (Note: The noise is mainly related to the materials and tread of bike tires. We highly suggest you to use road bikes because the noise will be louder if MTB is used.)
6 RESISTANCE SETTINGS: Train to your standards with bar-mounted remote and wide range resistance curve to simulate all cycling conditions

EASY BIKE RELEASE: Ready to head outside? Just hit the press-down lever clamp to easily release and remove your ride. Front wheel riser block and rear quick release lever are included for quick installation.
GREAT COMPABILITY: The Indoor Bike Trainer Stand fits any road or mountain bike with a 26-28" or 700c wheel and with rear wheel axel between 4.92'-6.57"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
